availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Hodges (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Francis Hodges. Father of Nancy Hodges, Eliza Hodges, Louisa M. Hodges, and Jacob Hodges. Farmer in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Infantry as a Private from November 5, 1861, to October 8, 1862. Died at the Battle of Chaplin Hills, Kentucky, on October 8, 1862. Employed C. C. Tharp in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned one enslaved individual in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved individuals in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 188A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, p. 448.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0283.
